fashion.title: VANITAS CORVINA
fashion.excerpt: This collection explores transformation and memory through the raven, a guide between worlds in Celtic mythology. Layered silhouettes, asymmetry, and iridescent fabrics trace the journey between the known and the unknown, inviting viewers into a space suspended between reality and myth.
fashion.description: This collection tells a story of transformation and memory, inspired by the raven as a guide between worlds in Celtic mythology. Each garment moves between the known and the unknown—layered silhouettes, asymmetry, and iridescent fabrics trace the journey of change, grief, and discovery. It's a reflection on thresholds, the uncanny, and the spaces where the familiar becomes strange, inviting the viewer to step into a world suspended between reality and myth.

fashion.title: NEON NEXUS
fashion.excerpt: This collection explores escapism and identity through fashion inspired by digital landscapes. Ripstop, cotton twill, and performance compression jersey in black, grey, and neon create layered, futuristic silhouettes that bridge the real and virtual. It’s a playful reflection on movement, transformation, and alternate realities.
fashion.description: Drawing inspiration from the immersive worlds of video games, this collection investigates escapism, identity, and the spaces between reality and imagination. Garments crafted from ripstop, cotton twill, and performance compression jersey in black, grey, and neon form layered, futuristic silhouettes that shift with movement, reflecting transformation and the thrill of alternate realities. Asymmetrical cuts, textural contrasts, and cyber-inspired details translate the energy of digital landscapes into wearable form, inviting viewers to step into a world where fashion and imagination collide. Everything was drawn entirely by hand.

fashion.title: PROJECTED NIGHTMARES
fashion.excerpt: This collection explores the emotional landscape of nightmares, turning shared fears into wearable narratives. Porcelain-inspired silhouettes feature custom toile de jouy patterns, which are projected onto the garments and hand-painted in gold, echoing kintsugi. It’s a study of contrast—beauty and unease, fragility and transformation—brought to life through material and light.
fashion.description: Projected Nightmares examines the universal experience of nightmares and the feelings they evoke. The first part of the collection draws from porcelain’s delicate strength and idyllic imagery, reimagined through custom toile de jouy patterns that translate subconscious anxieties into tactile form. In the second part, these patterns are projected onto the garments and hand-painted in gold, reminiscent of kintsugi, merging technology with craft to highlight the beauty within fragility and imperfection. Layered silhouettes, asymmetry, and tactile textures invite the viewer to inhabit a space where fear, memory, and transformation coexist, turning nightmares into something both unsettling and luminous.

fashion.title: BIOLOGICAL ENGINEERING
fashion.excerpt: This collection explores the intersection of fashion and biological engineering, developed in collaboration with my brother, a biological engineer.
fashion.description: This collection explores the intersection of fashion and biological engineering, developed in collaboration with my brother, a biological engineer. Through interviews and research into emerging materials—mycelium leather, bioplastics, velcro-inspired innovations, and other bio-based textiles—I investigated how biological engineering can inform both the function and form of garments. The collection translates these materials and concepts into futuristic silhouettes, textures, and details, highlighting adaptability, sustainability, and the potential of science-driven design. It reflects a dialogue between artistic vision and scientific innovation, showing how interdisciplinary collaboration can expand the possibilities of fashion.

fashion.title: ORNAMENTAL IRONWORK
fashion.excerpt: Inspired by the art of ornamental ironwork, this collection explores the interplay of structure, pattern, and fantasy.
fashion.description: Inspired by the art of ornamental ironwork, this collection explores the interplay of structure, pattern, and fantasy. Through research, interviews with ironwork artisans, and hands-on experimentation with the craft, I reinterpreted traditional motifs into voluminous silhouettes, intricate details, and layered forms that evoke a fairytale aesthetic. The garments mirror the tension of iron—strong yet delicate—while translating the precision and artistry of the craft into fashion. This collection celebrates the fusion of traditional techniques with imaginative design, inviting the wearer into a world where craft becomes narrative and structure transforms into whimsy.

art.title: LYRA SOLIS
art.excerpt: This project follows a full character production pipeline beginning with polygonal modeling and smoothing workflows in Maya. One side of the character was modeled and mirrored, then merged to create clean, symmetrical geometry. Clothing was developed through mesh manipulation techniques, and a custom hair mesh was created to define the character’s silhouette. All assets were UV mapped and imported into Adobe Substance Painter, where custom textures were hand-painted and exported across multiple texture maps. The character was fully rigged and animated with a short motion test. Final rendering used Arnold materials to achieve a stylized toon line effect, supported by scene building, lighting, and final image renders.
art.description: This project follows a full character production pipeline beginning with polygonal modeling and smoothing workflows in Maya. One side of the character was modeled and mirrored, then merged to create clean, symmetrical geometry. Clothing was developed through mesh manipulation techniques, and a custom hair mesh was created to define the character’s silhouette. All assets were UV mapped and imported into Adobe Substance Painter, where custom textures were hand-painted and exported across multiple texture maps. The character was fully rigged and animated with a short motion test. Final rendering used Arnold materials to achieve a stylized toon line effect, supported by scene building, lighting, and final image renders.

art.title: OWL BEAR
art.excerpt: This owl bear was designed by me and built entirely from a cube, fully textured, rigged, and animated. For the final presentation, I integrated the creature into a real-world photo, carefully matching lighting and shadows to create a seamless, realistic effect. This project showcases both my technical skills and my ability to bring fantastical creatures to life in believable environments.
art.description: Owl Bear is a fully realized 3D creature created in Maya, modeled from the ground up and brought to life through custom textures, rigging, and animation. The final piece places the creature into a real-world photograph, with carefully matched lighting and shadows to create a seamless, believable integration. This project highlights creature design, technical execution, and an emphasis on realism within fantastical world-building.

art.title: 3D Modeled House
art.excerpt: This project explores core 3D workflows in Maya, including polygon modeling, boolean operations for windows and architectural details, and object construction for interior assets such as a counter, bed, couch, curtains, blankets, and pillows. The project introduced UV mapping and texturing, along with form manipulation tools to create soft, inflated elements. Lighting was developed using Arnold lights and an HDRI background to establish realistic illumination and scene depth.
art.description: This project explores core 3D workflows in Maya, including polygon modeling, boolean operations for windows and architectural details, and object construction for interior assets such as a counter, bed, couch, curtains, blankets, and pillows. The project introduced UV mapping and texturing, along with form manipulation tools to create soft, inflated elements. Lighting was developed using Arnold lights and an HDRI background to establish realistic illumination and scene depth.

art.title: NEON NEXUS
art.excerpt: Neon Nexus is a cyberpunk-inspired game world where every choice reshapes the city around you. Players explore neon-lit streets, uncover hidden stories, and interact with dynamic characters whose actions ripple through both digital and physical spaces. The project blends immersive environments with narrative-driven gameplay, creating a world that challenges perceptions of technology, identity, and consequence.
art.description: Neon Nexus is a narrative-driven game concept set in a technologically advanced world shaped by AI and cybernetic enhancement. After a mysterious Nexus incident, a girl born from the digital landscape finds herself able to move between virtual and physical realities. As she struggles to belong, she uncovers a society fractured by technology, resistance, and control—forcing her to confront what it truly means to exist in a world where identity is no longer fixed.

art.title: KAIE
art.excerpt: Kaie is a top-down, story-driven puzzle game where reality bends and the familiar becomes uncanny. Players guide Kaie, a shy, game-obsessed boy, through a twisting, maze-like world filled with puzzles—and the strange noises that lurk in the dark. I created all pixel art and certain concept visuals, shaping the game’s eerie, immersive atmosphere.
art.description: Kaie is a story-based, top-down puzzle game that explores the boundary between the familiar and the unsettling. Players step into the shoes of Kaie, a shy, video-game obsessed boy who, while doing a simple task at home, finds himself in a strange, labyrinthine world. The game challenges players with complex puzzles and eerie encounters as they navigate the maze. I designed all pixel art and concept visuals, crafting the game’s distinctive aesthetic and mood, from character design to environments, creating an immersive experience where everyday life transforms into something mysterious and uncanny.

art.title: CLOVE
art.excerpt: This illustration of Clove (VALORANT) functions as a character design study, focused on visual language, mood, and form. Developed over 24 hours of concentrated pen-to-screen work, the piece explores how an existing character can be reinterpreted while remaining cohesive within an established game universe. Emphasis was placed on silhouette, color harmony, and attitude to reflect Clove’s identity, while incorporating my own stylistic sensibilities and interest in expressive, narrative-driven character design.
art.description: This illustration of Clove (VALORANT) functions as a character design study, focused on visual language, mood, and form. Developed over 24 hours of concentrated pen-to-screen work, the piece explores how an existing character can be reinterpreted while remaining cohesive within an established game universe. Emphasis was placed on silhouette, color harmony, and attitude to reflect Clove’s identity, while incorporating my own stylistic sensibilities and interest in expressive, narrative-driven character design.

art.title: LANDSCAPE RINGS
art.excerpt: This project involved designing and fabricating two rings inspired by a chosen landscape. I drew inspiration from Ionia (Runeterra), referencing its mountains and winding vines to inform the organic, layered forms of the rings. The rings were first carved in wax using files and a wax pen, starting from standard wax ring blanks. This process emphasized accuracy in ring sizing and maintaining true dimensions for casting. After casting the rings in silver, one ring was selected for stone setting. A minimum of two cabochons were bezel set into the cast form, integrating the stones into the flowing landscape-inspired structure. I chose carnelian for the settings to reflect the red color of the inspiration photo. The final pieces were refined through sanding and polishing to highlight the sculptural surfaces and stone settings.
art.description: This project involved designing and fabricating two rings inspired by a chosen landscape. I drew inspiration from Ionia (Runeterra), referencing its mountains and winding vines to inform the organic, layered forms of the rings. The rings were first carved in wax using files and a wax pen, starting from standard wax ring blanks. This process emphasized accuracy in ring sizing and maintaining true dimensions for casting. After casting the rings in silver, one ring was selected for stone setting. A minimum of two cabochons were bezel set into the cast form, integrating the stones into the flowing landscape-inspired structure. I chose carnelian for the settings to reflect the red color of the inspiration photo. The final pieces were refined through sanding and polishing to highlight the sculptural surfaces and stone settings.

art.title: PENDANT
art.excerpt: This pendant was designed as a vessel to hold an object of personal significance, with the project emphasizing soldering as a primary construction technique. The form was built using copper and brass to create contrast between warm metal tones and layered geometry. The construction incorporates point, butt, seam, and sandwich soldering, with multiple instances of each technique executed using silver solder. After sawing and assembling the form, the pendant and hand-fabricated chain were refined through extensive sanding and polishing to unify the surface while preserving material distinction.
art.description: This pendant was designed as a vessel to hold an object of personal significance, with the project emphasizing soldering as a primary construction technique. The form was built using copper and brass to create contrast between warm metal tones and layered geometry. The construction incorporates point, butt, seam, and sandwich soldering, with multiple instances of each technique executed using silver solder. After sawing and assembling the form, the pendant and hand-fabricated chain were refined through extensive sanding and polishing to unify the surface while preserving material distinction.

art.title: BUTTER & STAMPS
art.excerpt: This cuff project introduced core jewelry-making techniques, including sawing, sanding, texturing, riveting, annealing, and forming. Using the randomly assigned words butter and stamps, I developed three cuff designs inspired by ornamental butter knives, whose engraved patterns resemble stamped surfaces. I selected brass for its warm yellow tone, conceptually referencing butter. The metal was repeatedly annealed to soften it for both forming and texturizing, allowing for controlled bending and surface manipulation. Linear texture was created by running wire through a rolling mill, producing marks that evoke the motion of spreading butter. The cuff was finished through progressive sanding and polishing, and flat-topped rivets made from 18-gauge wire were added along one edge, reinforcing the stamped motif through rhythm and repetition.
art.description: This cuff project introduced core jewelry-making techniques, including sawing, sanding, texturing, riveting, annealing, and forming. Using the randomly assigned words butter and stamps, I developed three cuff designs inspired by ornamental butter knives, whose engraved patterns resemble stamped surfaces. I selected brass for its warm yellow tone, conceptually referencing butter. The metal was repeatedly annealed to soften it for both forming and texturizing, allowing for controlled bending and surface manipulation. Linear texture was created by running wire through a rolling mill, producing marks that evoke the motion of spreading butter. The cuff was finished through progressive sanding and polishing, and flat-topped rivets made from 18-gauge wire were added along one edge, reinforcing the stamped motif through rhythm and repetition.

art.title: LOGO DESIGN
art.excerpt: This personal logo was designed to represent my artist and designer identity under the name Soularii / Soulariius. The name draws from solarium and the Latin solarius, meaning “relating to the sun,” paired with “soul” to reflect a balance between light, dreaming, and introspection. Visually, the logo embraces clean design with subtle symbolism: a serif typeface that shifts from bold to light references moon phases, with a waxing crescent forming the “O” to signify growth and ambition. Yellow and purple merge solar and lunar themes, while the paired “I”s nod to duality and personal meaning. Designed to function across portfolios, games, and social platforms, the logo evokes a dreamy, elegant, and slightly mysterious tone aligned with my creative work.
art.description: This personal logo was designed to represent my artist and designer identity under the name Soularii / Soulariius. The name draws from solarium and the Latin solarius, meaning “relating to the sun,” paired with “soul” to reflect a balance between light, dreaming, and introspection. Visually, the logo embraces clean design with subtle symbolism: a serif typeface that shifts from bold to light references moon phases, with a waxing crescent forming the “O” to signify growth and ambition. Yellow and purple merge solar and lunar themes, while the paired “I”s nod to duality and personal meaning. Designed to function across portfolios, games, and social platforms, the logo evokes a dreamy, elegant, and slightly mysterious tone aligned with my creative work.

art.title: SCRAP
art.excerpt: This comic unfolds as a quiet, dreamlike sequence that explores uncertainty, longing, and movement through unfamiliar spaces. Rendered in stark black and white, the narrative relies on mood, rhythm, and visual repetition rather than explicit explanation. Meaning is left intentionally open-ended, allowing the viewer to engage with the work intuitively and construct their own interpretation through imagery, contrast, and silence.
art.description: This comic unfolds as a quiet, dreamlike sequence that explores uncertainty, longing, and movement through unfamiliar spaces. Rendered in stark black and white, the narrative relies on mood, rhythm, and visual repetition rather than explicit explanation. Meaning is left intentionally open-ended, allowing the viewer to engage with the work intuitively and construct their own interpretation through imagery, contrast, and silence.

art.title: 2 WEEK ZINE
art.excerpt: This zine is a black-and-white visual narrative inspired by the structure of an exquisite corpse, a surrealist method where multiple creators contribute without seeing the full work, producing unexpected and playful results. It follows a girl as she slowly dissolves into the earth, the sky, and eventually the cosmos. The pacing shifts through alternating light and dark pages, creating a gentle rhythm of transformation. Created over two weeks, the project is intimate, whimsical, and rooted in quiet world-building.
art.description: This zine is a black-and-white visual narrative inspired by the structure of an exquisite corpse, a surrealist method where multiple creators contribute without seeing the full work, producing unexpected and playful results. It follows a girl as she slowly dissolves into the earth, the sky, and eventually the cosmos. The pacing shifts through alternating light and dark pages, creating a gentle rhythm of transformation. Created over two weeks, the project is intimate, whimsical, and rooted in quiet world-building.
